pullRequest.body:
Provide theorems stating that `SimpleGraph.Walk.darts` and `SimpleGraph.Walk.edges` are injective functions, and that the length of `SimpleGraph.Walk.IsTrail` and `SimpleGraph.Walk.IsPath` is bounded for finite graphs.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

`+ darts_injective`
`+ edges_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for the feedback! I applied the suggested changes.

Turns out that `IsPath.length_lt_card_V` already exists as `IsPath.length_lt`, so I removed that theorem. It was a last-minute change for symmetry with `IsTrail.length_le_card_edgeFinset`, and apparently I didn't do my due diligence well enough.
Is there still something I should do to get this merged, or is this just waiting for a second round of reviews?
I'm not a maintainer, so I can't marge it, a maintainer has to merge it, so it's waiting. Any way, you should mark as resolved the suggestions that I made.

Thanks!

Thanks!

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks!
bors r+

```suggestion
    apply w.edges_subset_edgeSet
```

```suggestion
  exact Finset.card_le_card support.subset_univ
```

```suggestion
  | .nil, .nil, _ => rfl
```

```suggestion
    {w : G.Walk u v} (h : w.IsTrail) : w.length â‰¤ G.edgeFinset.card := by
```

```suggestion
theorem IsPath.length_lt_card_V [Fintype V] {u v : V} {w : G.Walk u v} (h : w.IsPath) :
```

Also, we don't mention variable names in theorem names, so you shouldn't use `V` in the theorem name. Maybe you can name it `IsPath.length_lt_card_vertices`, but I'm not sure. Maybe there is a better name
`IsPath.length_lt_card_verts`
Apparently this exists already as `IsPath.length_lt`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): darts and edges are injective for walks, length of paths and trails are bounded

### PR summary [d6e6af2b54](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15541/commits/d6e6af2b541bf5f90dbb10e36452f78b81bbcfdc)

`+ darts_injective`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for the feedback! I applied the suggested changes.

Turns out that `IsPath.length_lt_card_V` already exists as `IsPath.length_lt`, so I removed that theorem. It was a last-minute change for symmetry with `IsTrail.length_le_card_edgeFinset`, and apparently I didn't do my due diligence well enough.
Is there still something I should do to get this merged, or is this just waiting for a second round of reviews?
I'm not a maintainer, so I can't marge it, a maintainer has to merge it, so it's waiting. Any way, you should mark as resolved the suggestions that I made.

Thanks!
